name: Lancashire Day Ranger
description:
LANCASHIRE DAY RANGER Unlimited travel with weekday time restrictions for one day throughout Lancashire and parts of Greater Manchester and Merseyside. It extends from Silverdale and Wennington in the north to Liverpool and Manchester in the south and from the Lancashire coast in the west to Clitheroe, Colne and Hebden Bridge 
      in the east.

fares_and_restrictions.raw: fares & restrictions New fares from 2nd Mar 2025 One day ranger adult: £31.20 child (5-15): £15.60 16-17 saver: £15.60 railcards ⯆ 16 26 SE DI 2T FF H V : £20.75 FF H V child fare: £5.90 Railcards ⯈ Railcards: 16 = 16-25 26 = 26-30 SE = Senior DI = Disabled 2T = Two Together FF = Family & Friends H = HM Forces V = Veterans Previous fares ⯈ Previous fares (adult): 2024 - £29.80 2023 - £28.40 2022 - £26.80 2021 - £25.20 2020 - £25.20 2019 - £24.50 2018 - £23.80 2014 - £22.00 2011 - £19.00 time restrictions Mon to Fri: valid from 09:00 but 2T railcard not valid until 09:30 No restrictions at weekends or bank holidays train operating companies Avanti West Coast, CrossCountry, London Northwestern Railway, Merseyrail, Northern, TransPennine Express, Transport for Wales purchasing Online: X Train conductor: ✔ * Station ticket office: ✔ Ticket Vending Machine: i Northern Ticket Vending Machines now sell most ranger and rover tickets but at the moment only for same-day travel (rather prohibitive for distant areas) Some Avanti West Coast station TVMs for example Crewe, now sell local rangers and rovers. LNER TVMs at Doncaster, Edinburgh, London King's Cross, Newcastle and York also sell them. A number of PTE areas sell local rangers from TVMs in their area e.g. South Yorkshire, Strathclyde and West Midlands * valid ticket to travel is required unless boarded at a station without ticket-issuing facilities
